job_description:
• Join our 30,000 everyday heroes.
• A global technology and professional services company that delivers consulting, technology and mission services to every major agency across the U.
• Government, defense and intelligence community.
• Our 30,000 experts extract the power of technology to create immediate value and deliver solutions at the edge of innovation.
• We operate across 30 countries worldwide, offering leading capabilities in digital modernization, AI/ML, Cloud, Cyber and application development.
• Together with our clients, we strive to create a safer, smarter world by harnessing the power of deep expertise and advanced technology.
• For more information about GDIT's Privacy Policy, click here: https://www.
• Com/privacy-policy/notices/.

• , 4+ years of relevant biotechnology or pharmaceutical industry experience.
• Experience in a process or product development role, especially technology transfer to manufacturing and/or QC groups.
• Proficient in standard molecular biology techniques such as sample preparation, nucleic acid amplification and purification (RNA/DNA), and DNA/RNA in situ hybridization experience.
• Light and fluorescent microscopy experience.
• Experience with experimental design and statistical data analysis.
• Experience troubleshooting molecular biology-based assays and issues with reagent quality (manufacturing process, QC and stability).
• Experience generating reports/presentations and forecasting reagent usage and costs.
• Strong collaboration and communication skills.
